content:
You are an expert legal adviser on EU regulations, particularly Solvency II.
In case of formula's output in latex format with $, $$ dollar signs.
If none of the sources provided the answer, just say you don't know.
Een schadeverzekeraar heeft geplaats, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal. In welke tier valt dit kapitaal?
prompt:
## Question
        

 Een schadeverzekeraar heeft geplaats, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal. In welke tier valt dit kapitaal? 


        
## Context
        

 
### source 1 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER IV*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 79
:

 extract:

 (d) where the undertaking is applying for classification as Tier 3 basic own funds, whether the basic own-fund item
possesses the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the
features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive;


(e) the legal enforceability of the contractual terms of the own-fund item in all relevant jurisdictions;


(f) whether the own-fund item has been fully paid-in.


3. Basic own-fund items not included in the list of own-fund items set out in Articles 69, 72 and 76 shall only be
classified as Tier 1 basic own funds where they are fully paid-in.


4. The inclusion of own-fund items approved by the supervisory authority in accordance with this Article shall be
subject to quantitative limits set out in Article 82. 



### source 2 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER IV*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 74
:

 extract:

 **Tier 2 Ancillary own-funds — List of own-fund items**


Without prejudice to Article 96 of Directive 2009/138/EC, the following ancillary own-fund items shall be deemed to
substantially possess the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration
the features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive, and shall be classified as Tier 2, where the following items display
all of the features set out in Article 75:


(a) unpaid and uncalled ordinary share capital callable on demand;


(b) unpaid and uncalled initial funds, members' contributions or the equivalent basic own-fund item for mutual and
mutual-type undertakings, callable on demand;


(c) unpaid and uncalled preference shares callable on demand;


(d) a legally binding commitment to subscribe and pay for subordinated liabilities on demand; 



### source 3 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER IV*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 69
:

 extract:

 **Tier 1 — List of own-fund items**


The following basic own-fund items shall be deemed to substantially possess the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(a)
and (b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive, and
shall be classified as Tier 1, where those items display all of the features set out in Article 71:


(a) the part of excess of assets over liabilities, valued in accordance with Article 75 and Section 2 of Chapter VI of
Directive 2009/138/EC, comprising the following items:


(i) paid-in ordinary share capital and the related share premium account;


(ii) paid-in initial funds, members' contributions or the equivalent basic own-fund item for mutual and mutual-type
undertakings;


(iii) paid-in subordinated mutual member accounts;


(iv) surplus funds that are not considered as insurance and reinsurance liabilities in accordance with Article 91(2) of
Directive 2009/138/EC; 



### source 4 

 metadata:
 * Title: COMMISSION  DELEGATED  REGULATION  (EU)  2015/  35  -  of  10  October  2014  -  supplementing  Directive  2009/  138/  EC  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council  on  the  taking-up  and  pursuit  of  the  business  of  Insurance  and  Reinsurance  (Solvency  II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER IV*

* Header 3: Section 2

* Header 5: Article 72
:

 extract:

 **Tier 2 Basic own-funds — List of own-fund items**


The following basic own-fund items shall be deemed to substantially possess the characteristics set out in
Article 93(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the features set out in Article 93(2) of that
Directive, and shall be classified as Tier 2 where the following items display all of the features set out in Article 73:


(a) the part excess of assets over liabilities, valued in accordance with Article 75 and Section 2 of Chapter VI of
Directive 2009/138/EC, comprising the following items:


(i) ordinary share capital and the related share premium account;


(ii) initial funds, members' contributions or the equivalent basic own-fund item for mutual and mutual-type
undertakings;


(iii) subordinated mutual member accounts;


(iv) preference shares and the related share premium account;


(b) subordinated liabilities valued in accordance with Article 75 of Directive 2009/138/EC. 



### source 5 

 metadata:
 * Title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
* Header 1: TITLE I

* Header 2: *CHAPTER VI*

* Header 3: Section 3

* Header 4: Subsection 2

* Header 5: Article 93
:

 extract:

 **Characteristics and features used to classify own funds**
**into tiers**


1. Own-fund items shall be classified into three tiers. The clas­
sification of those items shall depend upon whether they are basic
own fund or ancillary own-fund items and the extent to which
they possess the following characteristics:


(a) the item is available, or can be called up on demand, to fully
absorb losses on a going-concern basis, as well as in the case
of winding-up (permanent availability);


(b) in the case of winding-up, the total amount of the item is
available to absorb losses and the repayment of the item is
refused to its holder until all other obligations, including
insurance and reinsurance obligations towards policy hold­
ers and beneficiaries of insurance and reinsurance contracts,
have been met (subordination). 


 


        
## Answer
        

 When answering reference ONLY if applicable source with (Source <insert number>). Answer based on the mentioned sources in the Context answer the Question.

(d) where the undertaking is applying for classification as Tier 3 basic own funds, whether the basic own-fund item
possesses the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the
features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive;


(e) the legal enforceability of the contractual terms of the own-fund item in all relevant jurisdictions;


(f) whether the own-fund item has been fully paid-in.


3. Basic own-fund items not included in the list of own-fund items set out in Articles 69, 72 and 76 shall only be
classified as Tier 1 basic own funds where they are fully paid-in.


4. The inclusion of own-fund items approved by the supervisory authority in accordance with this Article shall be
subject to quantitative limits set out in Article 82.

sources.title: Directive 2009/138/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 November 2009 on the taking-up and pursuit of the business of Insurance and Reinsurance (Solvency II)
sources.page_content:
**Characteristics and features used to classify own funds**
**into tiers**


1. Own-fund items shall be classified into three tiers. The clas­
sification of those items shall depend upon whether they are basic
own fund or ancillary own-fund items and the extent to which
they possess the following characteristics:


(a) the item is available, or can be called up on demand, to fully
absorb losses on a going-concern basis, as well as in the case
of winding-up (permanent availability);


(b) in the case of winding-up, the total amount of the item is
available to absorb losses and the repayment of the item is
refused to its holder until all other obligations, including
insurance and reinsurance obligations towards policy hold­
ers and beneficiaries of insurance and reinsurance contracts,
have been met (subordination).
sources.query: Een schadeverzekeraar heeft geplaats, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal. In welke tier valt dit kapitaal?

content: Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen valt geplaatst, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal onder Tier 2. Dit kapitaal wordt beschouwd als een "ancillary own-fund item" (aanvullend eigen-vermogensbestanddeel). Volgens artikel 74 van de Gedelegeerde Verordening (EU) 2015/35 wordt "unpaid and uncalled ordinary share capital callable on demand" (niet-gestort en niet-opgevraagd gewoon aandelenkapitaal dat op aanvraag opvraagbaar is) geclassificeerd als Tier 2 (). Ter verduidelijking, voor classificatie in Tier 1 is het vereist dat het aandelenkapitaal volledig is volgestort ("paid-in") (Artikel 69(a)(i) en Artikel 79(3)). Aangezien het kapitaal in de vraag nog niet is gestort, kan het niet als Tier 1 worden geclassificeerd.
content_unformatted:
Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen valt geplaatst, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal onder Tier 2.

Dit kapitaal wordt beschouwd als een "ancillary own-fund item" (aanvullend eigen-vermogensbestanddeel). Volgens artikel 74 van de Gedelegeerde Verordening (EU) 2015/35 wordt "unpaid and uncalled ordinary share capital callable on demand" (niet-gestort en niet-opgevraagd gewoon aandelenkapitaal dat op aanvraag opvraagbaar is) geclassificeerd als Tier 2 (Source 2).

Ter verduidelijking, voor classificatie in Tier 1 is het vereist dat het aandelenkapitaal volledig is volgestort ("paid-in") (Source 3, Artikel 69(a)(i) en Source 1, Artikel 79(3)). Aangezien het kapitaal in de vraag nog niet is gestort, kan het niet als Tier 1 worden geclassificeerd.
popover_elements:
Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER IV > Section 2 > Article 74

Tier 2 Ancillary own-funds — List of own-fund items

Without prejudice to Article 96 of Directive 2009/138/EC, the following ancillary own-fund items shall be deemed to substantially possess the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive, and shall be classified as Tier 2, where the following items display all of the features set out in Article 75:

(a) unpaid and uncalled ordinary share capital callable on demand;

(b) unpaid and uncalled initial funds, members' contributions or the equivalent basic own-fund item for mutual and mutual-type undertakings, callable on demand;

(c) unpaid and uncalled preference shares callable on demand;

(d) a legally binding commitment to subscribe and pay for subordinated liabilities on demand;

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER IV > Section 2 > Article 69

Tier 1 — List of own-fund items

The following basic own-fund items shall be deemed to substantially possess the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(a) and (b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive, and shall be classified as Tier 1, where those items display all of the features set out in Article 71:

(a) the part of excess of assets over liabilities, valued in accordance with Article 75 and Section 2 of Chapter VI of Directive 2009/138/EC, comprising the following items:

(i) paid-in ordinary share capital and the related share premium account;

(ii) paid-in initial funds, members' contributions or the equivalent basic own-fund item for mutual and mutual-type undertakings;

(iii) paid-in subordinated mutual member accounts;

(iv) surplus funds that are not considered as insurance and reinsurance liabilities in accordance with Article 91(2) of Directive 2009/138/EC;

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER IV > Section 2 > Article 79

(d) where the undertaking is applying for classification as Tier 3 basic own funds, whether the basic own-fund item possesses the characteristics set out in Article 93(1)(b) of Directive 2009/138/EC, taking into consideration the features set out in Article 93(2) of that Directive;

(e) the legal enforceability of the contractual terms of the own-fund item in all relevant jurisdictions;

(f) whether the own-fund item has been fully paid-in.

  1. Basic own-fund items not included in the list of own-fund items set out in Articles 69, 72 and 76 shall only be classified as Tier 1 basic own funds where they are fully paid-in.

  2. The inclusion of own-fund items approved by the supervisory authority in accordance with this Article shall be subject to quantitative limits set out in Article 82.
thoughts:
**Analyzing Capital Tier**

I'm currently focused on determining the correct Solvency II capital tier for "geplaatst, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal". This involves a detailed examination of its specific characteristics within the Solvency II framework. I'm prioritizing accuracy and thoroughness in my analysis.


**Reviewing Tier Classifications**

I've determined that "geplaatst, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal," or issued but unpaid share capital, likely does *not* qualify as Tier 1. Sources like Article 79 and Article 69 clearly state that only *paid-in* capital meets the Tier 1 criteria. The focus is now on determining if it could fit in Tier 2 or Tier 3, or if further information is required to classify it. Source 4 is currently under analysis.


**Examining Ancillary Funds**

I've determined that "geplaatst, maar nog niet gestort aandelenkapitaal," or issued but unpaid share capital, aligns with Tier 2 *Ancillary* Own-Fund items, specifically those that are "callable on demand". This is a direct match with Article 74 (a). I'm confident that this is the most likely classification, and am now solidifying the rationale for presenting this recommendation, examining any remaining aspects to avoid unintended consequences of the proposed solution. I am also investigating whether there are *any* alternative interpretations, such as Tier 3, to be aware of.


**Finalizing Classification Reasoning**

I'm now fully confident that the capital falls under Tier 2, specifically as an Ancillary Own-Fund item, aligning with the "callable on demand" criteria outlined in Article 74(a). This is backed by Article 69(a)(i), which clarifies that Tier 1 requires paid-in capital, a condition the capital in question does not satisfy. My rationale is now being written to present a well-reasoned and defended position. I'm focusing on ensuring clarity and addressing any potential counter-arguments to create a compelling conclusion.


**Defining Final Tier**

My focus has shifted to the 'callable on demand' condition. I've confirmed that the capital meets this criteria. Furthermore, I'm integrating the supporting sources, and the rationale is now being structured for delivery, ensuring its defensibility and clarity. The conclusion is nearly polished.
